thread.title: Using seawater and crisp packets to cut CO2 emissions

title: Using seawater and crisp packets to cut CO2 emissions
text:
Using seawater and crisp packets to cut CO2 emissions 10:44am GMT - 02:08 
University of York scientists say 850 million tonnes of carbon dioxide could be mineralised each year by combining sea water, graphite, solar-powered electricity, and scrap metal in a purpose-built reactor. Jim Drury reports. ▲ Hide Transcript ▶ View Transcript 
University of York scientists say 850 million tonnes of carbon dioxide could be mineralised each year by combining sea water, graphite, solar-powered electricity, and scrap metal in a purpose-built reactor. Jim Drury reports. Press CTRL+C (Windows), CMD+C (Mac), or long-press the URL below on your mobile device to copy the code https://reut.rs/2sqKuF3
